text: Here, I am testing with data given with data type as big-endian ">f8". With my commit, it should not be problem. Without my commit it should fail as scipy affine_transform does not handle well big-endian.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/image/tests/test_resampling.py')

text:
It does not seem like a great work-around. My guess is that this may not do the right thing with intermediary scipy versions, but I may be wrong about that.

In other words the bug that we reported to scipy was fixed in 0.15 but this one seems slightly different and needs more investigation (I have started digging into it this morning but no completely clear picture right now)
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/image/resampling.py')

text: It should be possible to detect whether or not endianness is swapped. I'll take a look into it also if I have time this evening.
title: (None, '', u'nilearn/image/resampling.py')

text:

@AlexandreAbraham in case you have not seen it, see my comment [here](https://github.com/nilearn/nilearn/issues/1445#issuecomment-300137244).
